definition.name: NXcomponent_em
definition.doc:
Base class for recurrent information of components used inside an electron microscope.
The electron microscope can be a real one or a virtual (simulated one). The key motivation behind this generalization is that in all cases a controlled electron beam is generated or simulated and then altered in a controlled manner for the purpose of studying physical interaction mechanism of the beam with matter (a real specimen or a simulated one).
Using a common description for the real experiment in the lab and what is typically a simplification of it via a computer simulation has the benefit that many pieces of information can be stored in the same way and thus ease guiding users to find such information.

field.name: description
field.doc: Ideally, a (globally) unique persistent identifier, link, or text to a resource which gives further details. If this does not exist a free-text field to report further details about the corrector.

field.name: depends_on
field.doc: Specifies the position of the lens by pointing to the last transformation in the transformation chain in the NXtransformations group.

group.doc: Collection of axis-based translations and rotations to describe the location and geometry of the component in the instrument.
